data.title: Empire Holdings
data.meta_description: With 40+ years of experience, Empire Holdings is building what you could never find in the commercial industrial market.
data.text:
Sara Esquivel Ministries (SEM) is a non-profit, Christian organization that strives to reach and help “one person at a time” by finding and offering resources that contribute to the comprehensive development of strong families. Through conferences, presentations and additional activities, SEM provides resources to impact physical, spiritual and emotional needs of clients.

Calverly Service Experts is one of more than 100 Service Experts locations in the country and provides commercial and residential HVAC installation and repair, as well as plumbing, duct cleaning and more in Tarrant and surrounding counties. With more than 1,000 employees, Service Experts generates revenues in excess of $500 million.

(LOI EXECUTED/LATE-STAGE LEASE NEGOTIATIONS)

Australian-headquartered Marand Precision Engineering engineers, manufactures and sustains complex innovative equipment and products for the aerospace, defense, mining, rail and energy industries with its customer base predominately blue-chip companies such as Lockheed Martin, Boeing, BAE Systems, BHP and Rio Tinto. Australia’s largest privately owned Aerostructures manufacturer and F-35 Joint Strike Fighter exporter, Marand has decades of experience in technology transfer as well as facilities design and build with automation. With an estimated 500 employees, Marand generates estimated revenues of $100 million.

(LOI EXECUTED/LATE-STAGE LEASE NEGOTIATIONS)

Mazzella Companies employ more than 800 individuals at more than 30 locations in North America. Mazzella is one of the largest independently owned companies in the overhead lifting and rigging industries and is a manufacturer and distributor of a wide range of lifting products for industrial, commercial and specialty applications. In addition, Mazzella is a leader in providing overhead cranes, overhead crane services, material handling, specialty machinery, and warehousing solutions. Some of the major markets served are Steel, Construction, Energy, Vehicle and Durable Goods, Ship Building/Repair, and Mining. Revenues are estimated at $185 million.

Clean Water Technology, Inc. (CWT), a global provider of water and wastewater treatment solutions, specializes in skid-mounted and packaged treatment systems. An innovator in wastewater technology, CWT’s products cover the entire realm of water and wastewater treatment with the highest degree of efficiency and sustainability as well as easy operability and flexibility. CWT’s innovative technologies focus on improving the water and wastewater industry. With 20 locations worldwide and more than 20 patents in the field of flotation and flocculation, CWT technologies surpass all others. With 18,000 employees, CWT generates $1.5 billion in revenues globally.

Skidabrader Group LLC is a national technology and solutions-based contractor services business for infrastructure preservation and renewal. Services include employing the unique technologies of Skidabrader®, Blastrac® (shot-blasting) and Cyclone Technologies® (Ultra High-Pressure water-blasting) for infrastructure rehabilitation, to improve friction and texture for safety on roads and runways. Skidabrader Group has regional operating centers, with Global Operations in Ft. Worth and continues to open more offices giving the company capability to dispatch anywhere in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, and the Middle East. With a 30-year history, Skidabrader is part of Bard Global Holdings (Founded in the late 1980’s in Denver, Colorado by Richard Bard with diverse portfolio holdings have included infrastructure and construction-related services, distribution, retail and franchise, manufacturing, technology, sports, banking, and real estate.) Revenues exceed $30 million.

Headquartered in Pennsylvania, TW Metals stocks and processes Tube, Pipe, Bar, Extrusions, Sheet and Plate in stainless, aluminum, nickel, titanium, and carbon alloy. With over 30 stocking locations in North America, Europe, and Asia, this global company serves the aerospace, government, medical, food service, and several other industries globally. TW Metals is now part of the O’Neal Industries affiliate companies – with a 115-year history. The company employs approximately 900 employees, generates $300 million in revenues and is in the top 200 of America’s privately held companies.

Axxis Building Systems, Inc., founded in 2012 and located in Fort Worth, is a regional company that provides architectural, project engineering design, construction, turn-key automation for industrial customers. Axxis Building Systems, Inc. has 22 total employees across all locations and generates $8+ million in sales.
